greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First differences of A128217.
comment: a(A130883(n-1)) = 2*n-1 and a(m) != 2*n-1 for m < A130883(n-1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 20 2015
formula: Let A(1)={1}. Then, for k=2,3,4,..., form A(k) by appending to A(k-1) the term k-1 followed by k-1 1's, if k is even, or by appending to A(k-1) the term k followed by k-1 1's, if k is odd. {a(n)} appears to be the limit of {A(k)} as k->infinity.
xref: Cf. A130883, A152271 (run lengths after initial term).
results.author: _John W. Layman_, Feb 19 2007
